title: Dorothy M. Horstmann
description: Dorothy Millicent Horstmann (July 2, 1911 â€“ January 11, 2001) was an American epidemiologist, virologist and pediatrician whose research on the spread of poliovirus in the human bloodstream helped set the stage for the development of the polio vaccine. She was the first woman appointed as a professor at the Yale School of Medicine.

title: Dorothy Horstmann: Polio Pioneer
description: This video is part of the Yale School of Medicine Bicentennial Voices series
